alert.note: Alert for Cameron (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 05 at 3:32PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Deep South Texas, including the following county, Cameron. * WHEN...Until 500 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 331 PM CDT, trained weather spotters reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Flooding was observed along the I-69E frontage road in Brownsville. Urban and small stream flooding will continue. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Los Fresnos, Rancho Viejo, Cameron Park, Olmito, Downtown Brownsville, Southmost, Port Of Brownsville, La Paloma, Brownsville, Lincoln Park, Vela Middle School, Valley Regional Medical Center, Driscoll Childrens Hospital, Brownsville Golf Center, Brownsville Sports Park, Brownsville Event Center, Rancho Verde Elementary School, Pullam Elementary School, Gallegos Elementary School and Sunrise Mall. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
